info.description: Create beautiful product and API documentation with our developer friendly platform.
info.title: ReadMe API ðŸ¦‰

get.summary: Retrieve an entry from the API Registry
get.description: Get an API definition file that's been uploaded to ReadMe.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: An API Registry UUID. This can be found by navigating to your API Reference page and viewing code snippets for Node with the `api` library.

post.description: Upload an API specification to ReadMe. Or, to use a newer solution see https://docs.readme.com/main/docs/rdme.

spec.description: OpenAPI/Swagger file. We accept JSON or YAML.

201.description: The API specification was successfully uploaded.

400.description: There was a validation error during upload.

put.description: Update an API specification in ReadMe.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the API specification. The unique ID for each API can be found by navigating to your **API Definitions** page.

spec.description: OpenAPI/Swagger file. We accept JSON or YAML.

400.description: There was a validation error during upload.

404.description: There is no API specification with that ID.

delete.description: Delete an API specification in ReadMe.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the API specification. The unique ID for each API can be found by navigating to your **API Definitions** page.

get.description: Returns all the roles we're hiring for at ReadMe!

200.description: All the roles that we're hiring for.

post.description: This endpoint will let you apply to a job at ReadMe programatically, without having to go through our UI!

get.description: Returns all the categories for a specified version.

post.description: Create a new category inside of this project.

201.description: The category has successfully been created.

get.description: Returns the category with this slug.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: A URL-safe representation of the category title. Slugs must be all lowercase, and replace spaces with hyphens. For example, for the category "Getting Started", enter the slug "getting-started".

200.description: The category exists and has been returned.

put.description: Change the properties of a category.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: A URL-safe representation of the category title. Slugs must be all lowercase, and replace spaces with hyphens. For example, for the category "Getting Started", enter the slug "getting-started".

delete.description:
Delete the category with this slug.
>âš ï¸Heads Up!
> This will also delete all of the docs within this category.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: A URL-safe representation of the category title. Slugs must be all lowercase, and replace spaces with hyphens. For example, for the category "Getting Started", enter the slug "getting-started".

get.description: Returns the docs and children docs within this category.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: A URL-safe representation of the category title. Slugs must be all lowercase, and replace spaces with hyphens. For example, for the category "Getting Started", enter the slug "getting-started".

200.description: The category exists and all of the docs have been returned.

400.description: There was a validation error during creation.

get.description: Returns the changelog with this slug.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: A URL-safe representation of the changelog title. Slugs must be all lowercase, and replace spaces with hyphens. For example, for the changelog "Owlet Update", enter the slug "owlet-update".

200.description: The changelog exists and has been returned.

404.description: There is no changelog with that slug.

put.description: Update a changelog with this slug.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: A URL-safe representation of the changelog title. Slugs must be all lowercase, and replace spaces with hyphens. For example, for the changelog "Owlet Weekly Update", enter the slug "owlet-weekly-update".

400.description: There was a validation error during update.

404.description: There is no changelog with that slug.

delete.description: Delete the changelog with this slug.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: A URL-safe representation of the changelog title. Slugs must be all lowercase, and replace spaces with hyphens. For example, for the changelog "Owlet Weekly Update", enter the slug "owlet-weekly-update".

404.description: There is no changelog with that slug.

get.description: Returns a list of custom pages.

post.description: Create a new custom page inside of this project.

201.description: The custom page was successfully created.

get.description: Returns the custom page with this slug.

200.description: The custom page exists and has been returned.

put.description: Update a custom page with this slug.

200.description: The custom page was successfully updated.

delete.description: Delete the custom page with this slug.

204.description: The custom page was successfully updated.

get.description: Returns the doc with this slug.

200.description: The doc exists and has been returned.

put.description: Update a doc with this slug.

delete.description: Delete the doc with this slug.

get.description: This is intended for use by enterprise users with staging enabled. This endpoint will return the live version of your document, whereas the standard endpoint will always return staging.

200.description: The doc exists and has been returned.

post.description: Create a new doc inside of this project.
Returns all docs that match the search.

200.description: The search was successful and results were returned.

get.summary: Get metadata about the current project
get.description: Returns project data for the API key.
Returns a copy of our OpenAPI Definition.
Retrieve a list of versions associated with a project API key.

400.description: There was a validation error during creation.

get.description: Returns the version with this version ID.

200.description: The version exists and has been returned.

link.description: Pagination information. See https://docs.readme.com/main/reference/pagination for more information.

x-total-count.description: The total amount of results, ignoring pagination. See https://docs.readme.com/main/reference/pagination for more information about pagination.

slug.name: slug
slug.description: A URL-safe representation of the page title. Slugs must be all lowercase, and replace spaces with hyphens. For example, for the title "Getting Started", enter the slug "getting-started".

page.name: page
page.description: Used to specify further pages (starts at 1).

perPage.name: perPage
perPage.description: Number of items to include in pagination (up to 100, defaults to 10).

x-readme-version.name: x-readme-version
x-readme-version.description: Version number of your docs project, for example, v3.0. By default the main project version is used. To see all valid versions for your docs project call https://docs.readme.com/main/reference/version#getversions.

versionId.name: versionId
versionId.description: Semver identifier for the project version. For best results, use the formatted `version_clean` value listed in the response from the [Get Versions endpoint](/reference/getversions).

error_APIKEY_EMPTY.description: An API key was not supplied.

error_APIKEY_MISMATCH.description: The API key doesn't match the project.

error_APIKEY_NOTFOUND.description: The API key couldn't be located.

error_APPLY_INVALID_EMAIL.description: You need to provide a valid email.

error_APPLY_INVALID_JOB.description: You need to provide a job.

error_APPLY_INVALID_NAME.description: You need to provide a name.

error_CUSTOMPAGE_NOTFOUND.description: The custom page couldn't be found.

error_PROJECT_NEEDSSTAGING.description: The project does not have staging enabled.

error_RATE_LIMITED.description: The request has been rate limited.

error_REGISTRY_INVALID.description: The registry entry couldn't be found.

error_REGISTRY_NOTFOUND.description: The registry entry couldn't be found.

error_SPEC_ID_DUPLICATE.description: The spec ID already tied to another version.

error_SPEC_INVALID.description: The uploaded spec isn't valid JSON or YAML.

error_SPEC_INVALID_SCHEMA.description: The uploaded spec has OpenAPI validation errors.

error_SPEC_VERSION_NOTFOUND.description: The spec version couldn't be found.

error_VERSION_CANT_DEMOTE_STABLE.description: A stable version can't be demoted.

error_VERSION_CANT_REMOVE_STABLE.description: A stable version can't be removed.

error_VERSION_FORK_EMPTY.description: New versions need to be forked from an existing version.

error.description: An error code unique to the error received.

message.description: The reason why the error occured.

suggestion.description: A helpful suggestion for how to alleviate the error.

docs.description: A [ReadMe Metrics](https://readme.com/metrics/) log URL where you can see more information the request that you made. If we have metrics URLs unavailable for your request, this URL will be a URL to our API Reference.

help.description: Information on where you can receive additional assistance from our wonderful support team.
help.example: If you need help, email support@readme.io

poem.description: A short poem we wrote you about your error.
example: Things didn't quite go the way we hoped.
When we tried to process your request,
Maybe trying again it'll workâ€”who knows!

email.description: A valid email we can reach you at.

job.description: The job you're looking to apply for (https://readme.com/careers).

linkedin.description: What have you been up to the past few years?

github.description: Or Bitbucket, Gitlab or anywhere else your code is hosted!

coverLetter.description: What should we know about you?

dontReallyApply.description: Want to play with the API but not actually apply? Set this to true.

title.description: A short title for the category. This is what will show in the sidebar.

type.description: A category can be part of your reference or guide documentation, which is determined by this field.

baseUrl.description: The base URL for the project. If the project is not running under a custom domain, it will be `https://projectSubdomain.readme.io`, otherwise it can either be or `https://example.com` or, in the case of an enterprise child project `https://example.com/projectSubdomain`.

body.description: Body formatted in Markdown (displayed by default).

html.description: Body formatted in HTML (sanitized, only displayed if `htmlmode` is **true**).

htmlmode.description: **true** if `html` should be displayed, **false** if `body` should be displayed.

type.description: Type of the page. The available types all show up under the /docs/ URL path of your docs project (also known as the "guides" section). Can be "basic" (most common), "error" (page desribing an API error), or "link" (page that redirects to an external link).

body.description: Body content of the page, formatted in [ReadMe-flavored Markdown](https://docs.readme.com/rdmd/docs).

category.description: Category ID of the page, which you can get through [the **Get all categories** endpoint](https://docs.readme.com/main/reference/getcategories).

order.description: The position of the page in your project sidebar.

parentDoc.description: The parent doc's ID, if the page is a subpage.

code.description: The error code for docs with the "error" type.

categorySlug.description: The slug of the category this page is associated with. You can get this through [the **Get all categories** endpoint](https://docs.readme.com/main/reference/getcategories). This field is an alternative to the `category` field.

parentDocSlug.description: If this page is a subpage, this field will be the slug of the parent document. You can get this through https://docs.readme.com/main/reference/docs#getdoc. This field is an alternative to the `parentDoc` field.

type.description: Type of the page. The available types all show up under the /docs/ URL path of your docs project (also known as the "guides" section). Can be "basic" (most common), "error" (page desribing an API error), or "link" (page that redirects to an external link).

body.description: Body content of the page, formatted in [ReadMe-flavored Markdown](https://docs.readme.com/rdmd/docs).

category.description: Category ID of the page, which you can get through [the **Get all categories** endpoint](https://docs.readme.com/main/reference/getcategories).

order.description: The position of the page in your project sidebar.

parentDoc.description: The parent doc's ID, if the page is a subpage.

code.description: The error code for docs with the "error" type.

categorySlug.description: The slug of the category this page is associated with. You can get this through [the **Get all categories** endpoint](https://docs.readme.com/main/reference/getcategories). This field is an alternative to the `category` field.

parentDocSlug.description: If this page is a subpage, this field will be the slug of the parent document. You can get this through https://docs.readme.com/main/reference/docs#getdoc. This field is an alternative to the `parentDoc` field.

type.description: Type of the page. The available types all show up under the /docs/ URL path of your docs project (also known as the "guides" section). Can be "basic" (most common), "error" (page desribing an API error), or "link" (page that redirects to an external link).

body.description: Body content of the page, formatted in [ReadMe-flavored Markdown](https://docs.readme.com/rdmd/docs).

category.description: Category ID of the page, which you can get through [the **Get all categories** endpoint](https://docs.readme.com/main/reference/getcategories).

order.description: The position of the page in your project sidebar.

parentDoc.description: The parent doc's ID, if the page is a subpage.

code.description: The error code for docs with the "error" type.

from.description: Semantic Version to use as the base fork.

is_deprecated.description: Should this be deprecated? Only allowed in PUT operations.

slug.description: A slugified version of the job opening title.

description.description: The description for this open position. This content is formatted as HTML.

pullquote.description: A short pullquote for the open position.
pullquote.example: Deeply knowledgeable of the web, HTTP, and the API space.

location.description: Where this position is located at.

department.description: The internal organization you'll be working in.

url.description: The place where you can apply for the position!
